Schema

Source: vignettes/Schema.Rmd
Schema.Rmd

There are currently two functions in STATcubeR that utilize the /schema endpoint. The first function shows the catalogue, which lists all available databases in a tree form. The tree structure is determined by the API and closely resembles the “Katalog” view in the GUI.

my_catalogue <- sc_schema_catalogue()
my_catalogue
##                                                                  levelName     type
## 1  Extern V9                                                                 FOLDER
## 2   ¦--Examples                                                              FOLDER
## 3   ¦   ¦--Communes (Demo)                                                 DATABASE
## 4   ¦   ¦--People                                                          DATABASE
## 5   ¦   ¦--People multilingual                                             DATABASE
## 6   ¦   °--Retail Banking ML en                                            DATABASE
## 7   ¦--Publications and services                                             FOLDER
## 8   ¦   ¦--Economic Trend Monitor                                            FOLDER
## 9   ¦   ¦   °--Economic Trend Monitor                                      DATABASE
## 10  ¦   °--Austrian Economic Atlas                                           FOLDER
## 11  ¦       ¦--01 Key data Austria and European Union                      DATABASE
## 12  ¦       ¦--02 Key data Federal provinces                               DATABASE
## 13  ¦       ¦--03 Key data on economic branches                            DATABASE
## 14  ¦       ¦--04 Key data on economic branches by enterprise size classes DATABASE
## 15  ¦       ¦--05 Key data on economic branches compared with the EU       DATABASE
## 16  ¦       ¦--06 Key data on economic branches by federal provinces       DATABASE
## 17  ¦       ¦--07 Key data industry                                        DATABASE
## 18  ¦       ¦--08 Key data construction                                    DATABASE
## 19  ¦       ¦--09 Key data trade                                           DATABASE
## 20  ¦       ¦--10 Key data tourism                                         DATABASE
## 21  ¦       ¦--11 Key data transport                                       DATABASE
## 22  ¦       ¦--12 Key data foreign trade                                   DATABASE
## 23  ¦       °--13 Key data agriculture and foresty                         DATABASE
## 24  °--Statistics                                                            FOLDER
## 25      ¦--Labour Market                                                     FOLDER
## 26      ¦   ¦--Job Vacancies                                                 FOLDER
## 27      ¦   ¦   ¦--Offene Stellen (Jahresdurchschnitt) ab 2009             DATABASE
## 28      ¦   ¦   °--Offene Stellen Quartale ab 2009                         DATABASE
## 29      ¦   ¦--Working hours (Labour Force Survey)                         DATABASE
## 30      ¦   °--... 3 nodes w/ 0 sub                                                
## 31      °--... 18 nodes w/ 603 sub

Now my_catalogue can be used to obtain database ids.

my_catalogue$Statistics$`Labour Market`
##                                                        levelName     type
## 1 Labour Market                                                    FOLDER
## 2  ¦--Job Vacancies                                                FOLDER
## 3  ¦   ¦--Offene Stellen (Jahresdurchschnitt) ab 2009            DATABASE
## 4  ¦   °--Offene Stellen Quartale ab 2009                        DATABASE
## 5  ¦--Working hours (Labour Force Survey)                        DATABASE
## 6  ¦--Austrian Micro census - Labour Force Survey Yearly Data    DATABASE
## 7  ¦--Austrian Micro census - Labour Force Survey Quarterly Data DATABASE
## 8  °--Microcensus Time Series since 1974                         DATABASE
my_catalogue$Statistics$`Labour Market`$`Working hours (Labour Force Survey)`
## $id
## [1] "str:database:deake005"
## 
## $label
## [1] "Working hours (Labour Force Survey)"
## 
## $location
## [1] "http://sdbext:8082/statistik.at/ext/statcube/rest/v1/schema/str:database:deake005"
## 
## $type
## [1] "DATABASE"
## 
## $lastModified
## [1] 1.612783e+12
## 
## $recordViewEnabled
## [1] FALSE

To get more information about this database, you can pass the id to sc_db_info(). Again, the contents do have a tree structure which is similar to the sidebar of the “Tabellenansicht” view.

my_db_info <- sc_schema_db("deake005")
my_db_info
##                                                                                   levelName     type
## 1  Working hours (Labour Force Survey)                                                      DATABASE
## 2   ¦--Factors                                                                                 GROUP
## 3   ¦   ¦--Average hours actually worked per week                                            MEASURE
## 4   ¦   ¦   °--Average hours actually worked per week                                            SUM
## 5   ¦   ¦--Average hours usually worked per week                                             MEASURE
## 6   ¦   ¦   °--Average hours usually worked per week                                             SUM
## 7   ¦   ¦--Volume of hours worked in the main job per year in million hours                  MEASURE
## 8   ¦   ¦   °--Volume of hours worked in the main job per year in million hours                  SUM
## 9   ¦   ¦--Volume of hours worked overtime (paid) per year in million hours                  MEASURE
## 10  ¦   ¦   °--Volume of hours worked overtime (paid) per year in million hours                  SUM
## 11  ¦   ¦--Volume of hours worked overtime (unpaid) per year in million hours                MEASURE
## 12  ¦   ¦   °--Volume of hours worked overtime (unpaid) per year in million hours                SUM
## 13  ¦   ¦--Volume of hours worked overtime (paid/unpaid) per year in million hours           MEASURE
## 14  ¦   ¦   °--Volume of hours worked overtime (paid/unpaid) per year in million hours           SUM
## 15  ¦   ¦--Volume of hours worked in the second job per year in million hours                MEASURE
## 16  ¦   ¦   °--Volume of hours worked in the second job per year in million hours                SUM
## 17  ¦   ¦--Average hours worked overtime per week related to the total of employees          MEASURE
## 18  ¦   ¦   °--Average hours worked overtime per week related to the total of employees          SUM
## 19  ¦   °--Average hours worked overtime per week related to employees working overtime      MEASURE
## 20  ¦       °--Average hours worked overtime per week related to employees working overtime      SUM
## 21  ¦--Facts                                                                                   GROUP
## 22  ¦   ¦--GEWTATJAHR                                                                        MEASURE
## 23  ¦   ¦   °--GEWTATJAHR                                                                        SUM
## 24  ¦   ¦--GEWJAHR                                                                           MEASURE
## 25  ¦   ¦   °--GEWJAHR                                                                           SUM
## 26  ¦   ¦--TATSTUNDMALGEW                                                                    MEASURE
## 27  ¦   ¦   °--TATSTUNDMALGEW                                                                    SUM
## 28  ¦   ¦--STUNDMALGEW                                                                       MEASURE
## 29  ¦   ¦   °--STUNDMALGEW                                                                       SUM
## 30  ¦   °--... 13 nodes w/ 13 sub                                                                   
## 31  °--... 7 nodes w/ 105 sub

my_db_info can be used in a similar fashion as my_catalogue to obtain details about the resources in the tree. For example, the VALUESET with the label “Herkunftsland” can be viewed like this.

my_db_info$`Demographic Characteristics`
##                                                                                          levelName     type
## 1  Demographic Characteristics                                                                        GROUP
## 2   ¦--Gender                                                                                         FIELD
## 3   ¦   °--Gender                                                                                  VALUESET
## 4   ¦--Age in years-groups                                                                            FIELD
## 5   ¦   ¦--Age in years-groups                                                                     VALUESET
## 6   ¦   ¦--Alter in Jahresgruppen                                                                  VALUESET
## 7   ¦   °--Alter (Ebene +1)                                                                        VALUESET
## 8   ¦--Highest level of training completed (national classification)                                  FIELD
## 9   ¦   ¦--Highest level of training completed (national classification)                           VALUESET
## 10  ¦   °--Höchste abgeschlossene Schulbildung - nationale Gliederung (Ebene +1)                   VALUESET
## 11  ¦--Highest level of training completed (ISCED 97)                                                 FIELD
## 12  ¦   ¦--Highest level of training completed (ISCED 97)                                          VALUESET
## 13  ¦   °--Höchste abgeschlossene Ausbildung (ISCED-97) (Ebene +1)                                 VALUESET
## 14  ¦--Highest level of training completed (ISCED 2011)                                               FIELD
## 15  ¦   ¦--Highest level of training completed (ISCED 2011)                                        VALUESET
## 16  ¦   °--Höchste abgeschlossene Schulbildung - internationale Gliederung (ISCED 2011) (Ebene +1) VALUESET
## 17  ¦--Nationality                                                                                    FIELD
## 18  ¦   ¦--Nationality                                                                             VALUESET
## 19  ¦   °--Staatsangehörigkeit                                                                     VALUESET
## 20  ¦--Country of birth                                                                               FIELD
## 21  ¦   ¦--Country of birth                                                                        VALUESET
## 22  ¦   °--Geburtsland Österreich                                                                  VALUESET
## 23  °--Migration background                                                                           FIELD
## 24      ¦--Migration background                                                                    VALUESET
## 25      °--Migrationshintergrund (Ebene +1)                                                        VALUESET
my_db_info$`Demographic Characteristics`$Gender$Gender
##                  levelName     type
## 1 Gender                   VALUESET
## 2  ¦--male                    VALUE
## 3  ¦--female                  VALUE
## 4  °--Not classifiable <0>    VALUE
my_db_info$`Demographic Characteristics`$Gender$Gender$male
## $id
## [1] "str:value:deake005:F-DATA:C-C11-0:C-C11-0:C11-1"
## 
## $label
## [1] "male"
## 
## $location
## [1] "http://sdbext:8082/statistik.at/ext/statcube/rest/v1/schema/str:value:deake005:F-DATA:C-C11-0:C-C11-0:C11-1"
## 
## $type
## [1] "VALUE"
